intro: Neobertiera glomerata, commonly known as the clustered neobertiera, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
